Talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Sadly, while I was busy making this place
a ewe-topia, our Cucco went missing.
Talk29:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>That poor, sweet bird always <clr:0000>hated being
alone<clr:ffff>. She <clr:0000>wouldn't lay eggs <clr:ffff>unless one
of us was nearby.<sp:5:1:0>
I hate to think how scared and lonely she
must be...

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Sometimes I swear I hear a sad squawking sound
and it <clr:0000>wakes me up<clr:ffff>... But that must be a dream...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk30:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>Just kidding! <sp:5:0:0>A bit of sheep humor
for you.<sp:5:0:0> The place you're at is actually
called South Akkala Stable.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Since we've always had so many sheep
here, some visitors started calling us the
"sheep stable."
So I thought, why not embrace it?
And I started taking extra good care
of the sheep.
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Before I knew it, even more showed up!
It was like a woolly invasion!

But no complaints from me. I think they're
just adorable!
Talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:TalkPositive_00>I try to keep my attitude sunny, even
when the weather isn't.
Talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>At this point, I might have to go and see
the <clr:0000>god of horses<clr:ffff>. He's rumored to be
at <clr:0000>East Akkala Stable <clr:ffff>to the northeast.
I know he's not the god of birds, but still,
maybe he has the power to protect my
dear Cucco.
Talk32:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You know, there's another stable to the
<clr:0000>northeast <clr:ffff>called <clr:0000>East Akkala Stable<clr:ffff>.

There's a so-called <clr:0000>horse god<clr:ffff> around
there who's said to be quite powerful.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>I bet if I ask nicely, he'll watch over my
beloved Cucco for me!

I'm going to go there next chance I get
and ask him.

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Cuccos aren't horses, obviously... <sp:5:0:0>But they are both
animals, so I'm sure he can still help... <sp:5:1:0>Right?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk23:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm so worried about our missing Cucco.<sp:5:0:0>
She always hated being alone.

She <clr:0000>wouldn't lay eggs <clr:ffff>when she was
<clr:0000>by herself<clr:ffff>, so I made a point to spend
quality time with her every day.
But I got so preoccupied with the sheep,
it slipped my mind, and now...

I just wish she had a <clr:0000>friend<clr:ffff> to keep
her company.

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Sometimes I swear I hear a sad squawking sound
and it <clr:0000>wakes me up<clr:ffff>...<sp:5:0:0> But that must be a dream...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk27:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Hm. <sp:5:0:0>I could have sworn I heard a Cucco
crying out in the distance...<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0401>Huh?! <sp:5:0:0>Oh gosh! <sp:5:0:0>I'm so sorry! I was
counting the sheep and ended up
dozing off.
Talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS_00>Sir, aren't you going to take shelter?
You'll get soaked out in this rain!
Talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>For a while, I'd wake up to a sad
squawking sound in the distance, almost
as if she was crying out for a friend.
But lately the squawking sounds <sp:5:0:0>happier!


<snd:Happy_00>I know I probably dreamed all of that.
But it comforts me to think that wherever
she is, she's not alone anymore.
